intro: Ononis natrix var. ambigua, commonly known as the ambiguous sandwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils. The plant features small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are usually opposite and linear. It is a perennial herb that often forms dense mats, helping to stabilize soil in its arid habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species in certain regions.
